word: IT IS OUR PRIVILEGE TO KNEEL WHEN IN PRAYER.\97Both in public and in private worship it is our privilege to bow on our knees before God when we offer our petitions to Him. Jesus, our example, \93kneeled down, and prayed.\94 Luke 22:41. Of His disciples it is recorded that they, too, \93kneeled down, and prayed.\94 Acts 9:40. Paul declared, \93I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.\94 Ephesians 3:14. In confessing before God the sins of Israel, Ezra knelt. See Ezra 9:5. Daniel \93kneeled upon his knees three times a day, and prayed, and gave thanks before his God.\94 Daniel 6:10.\97(Prophets and Kings, 48.)
